alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 8:17AM EDT until June 24 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Shallow flooding with a half to up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Virginia Beach along North Landing River and Back Bay. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect up to a half to one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/01 AM 3.2 0.4 0.9 1 NONE 24/02 PM 3.4 0.6 1.2 1 NONE 25/02 AM 3.2 0.4 1.0 1 NONE 25/03 PM 3.5 0.7 1.2 1 NONE 26/03 AM 3.1 0.3 1.0 2 NONE 26/04 PM 3.4 0.6 1.0 2 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/01 AM 3.1 0.2 0.6 2 NONE 24/01 PM 3.3 0.4 1.0 1 NONE 25/02 AM 3.4 0.5 1.0 1 NONE 25/02 PM 3.4 0.5 1.0 1 NONE 26/02 AM 3.2 0.3 1.0 2 NONE 26/03 PM 3.5 0.6 1.0 2-3 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 24/02 AM 3.1 0.4 1.0 1 NONE 24/02 PM 3.3 0.6 1.3 1 NONE 25/02 AM 3.2 0.5 1.2 1 NONE 25/02 PM 3.4 0.7 1.4 1 NONE 26/03 AM 3.1 0.4 1.2 1 NONE 26/03 PM 3.3 0.6 1.2 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
